alert.note: Alert for City and Borough of Juneau (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 12:56PM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...A Strong Storm Moves Through the Panhandle... A gale force low with a significant source of moisture is currently moving through the the Gulf of Alaska. So far around 1 to 1.5 inches of rain has fallen across the area with another 1 to 1.5 before the heaviest precipitation looks to shift away from Juneau this evening. Small streams are expected to rapid rises from the heavy rainfall amounts with some reaching bankfull. For those along the Mendenhall River, the rainy and windy conditions could increase the risk of trees falling into and around from the already unstable river banks. This front is also bringing windy conditions to Juneau area with reports of gusts as high as 35 mph near the airport with less winds towards the back of Mendenhall Valley. These sustained winds of 15 to 25 mph with periods of high gusts to 25 to 35 mph is expected to continue into the early evening before diminishing.
